reviews.text: The Peninsula is a time-share condominium complex located facing the ocean in Sea Point, Cape Town. The spacious rooms, which include (in my case) a very large room that served as your bedroom and living room. The living room area had comfortable casual furniture looking out a window over the pool and out to the ocean. The bed was at the back of this large room and was placed on a platform so that in the morning, you woke to see the same gorgeous view of the ocean out the window. The bed was comfortable and I slept well each and every night of my 8 nights at the Peninsula.
reviews.title: The perfect holiday.....so sad to be back home!

likes.liked: — Friendly helpful staff, great sized room with nice extras -jacuzzi etc, shuttle bus, location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: But, this is not all. The suites have a full kitchen that is thoughtfully supplied with everything you need to cook wonderful meals. The granite countertops are a nice touch and an indication that the furnishings as a whole are of high quality. It was a delight to prepare meals in "my" kitchen and eat on the adjoining balcony overlooking the ocean.

reviews.text: I have just had the pleasure of an 8 night stay at the Peninsula and was personally welcomed by Chris the General Manager. Being an ex hotelier of 4 star Thames Valley hotels I was delighted to learn that Chris had spent some time working in England as well.

The complimentary shuttle service covered trips to Table Mountain, Camps Bay and the Waterfront and even some of my busines appointments within an 8 km distance of the hotel

We stayed at the Peninsula in May 2006 after being on safari in South Africa. The accomodations were nice but I would not characterize them as superb as others have. We had a two bedroom suite that was generally clean and comfortable but a bit worn.

reviews.text: The hotel has a great view of the water and is located in Sea Point. The hotel shuttle was very nice and we used it daily. Please note that you must book it ahead of time so once you figure out where you want to go, book it!! The shuttle drivers were very nice and considerate.

reviews.text: Besides one female, the hotel staff was good. The young woman at the desk did not "catch on" to things quickly but the manager was very nice and took things over from her when she was unable to process requests.

reviews.title: dont miss this one
reviews.text: The people at the hotel have a tendency to push their restaurant which we did not eat at due to the other reviews of it. Go to Camps Bay or the Waterfront = lots of choices.

We arrived early morning after our flight and the staff greeting us could not have been more friendly and helpful. We were given breakfast as our suite was not ready, and better still we were not charged for this. We were booked into the super luxury suite located on the 11th floor, the view was fantasticc as we could see the Lions Head from our balcony and had lovely sunsets each night. The suite was very large clean and well maintained. Breakfast was a fantastic spread each morning. We had a free African food buffet on the Monday night which was surpisingly good as it was free. The shuttle bus was a great asset, taking us down to the Waterfront each evening for our meal, but also to Table Mountain on another occassion. We only paid £245 for a four night stay, which I think was excellent value. Our experience was very good and I would thoroughly recommend the Peninsula to anyone else travelling to Cape Town.

Everyone in the hotel was polite and friendly.The rooms were cleaned everyday. It was amazing to wake up in the morning and to open the curtains and see the whales swimming in the sea. Also the shuttle service was very good they would try to fit you in where they could . Altogether a fantastic hotel we would recommend to everyone

reviews.text: After reading the reviews I was confident of a good hotel for my 4 night stay recently. But I think I must have checked into the wrong one. I have booked a super luxuary 2 bedroom suite direct with summit hotels. On arrival we checked in easily and effeciently and were shown to our room which was a dark beer stainned cigerette smelling cell on the ground floor. The room had thick cage like bars covering all windows and the second bedroom have lovuvre windows that opened behind the bars to the hotels carridor. The full sea view was very pleasant once could see across the busy main road. and look over the wall We went straight to the front desk and where offered 3 alternatives none of them fitted the super luxary description of the webiste one has a great view of a building sight. all room shown where dirty ans smelt of booze and cigerettesand on arrving to view 2 of the room loud drunken laughter could be heard from outside and insde the apartments. We checked out of the hotel and would advise you to think twice before booking this place.
